betterquesting:10.desc:8: Okay okay, We all know punching wood is the first thing you do in minecraft, but this modpack has ore excavator. Simply hold down ~ (by default) while punching the tree.

If You haven't noticed already, You are probably starting to freeze. To survive the cold you can simply mine into a hill about 10 blocks to get out of the cold. If you don't have a hill simply just dig downwards about 22 blocks. (those numbers are the minimum for night time survival)

It depends where you are but that should do just fine.

Another way to stay warm is to craft and light a campfire, simply place it and then light it with a flint and steel.

You are probably already thirsty from punching all that wood. To drink you can simply sneek and right click on water, however that will give you the thirst effect since it isn't clean. (Basically the hunger effect but for water)

To clean water we can make some charcoal filters and then craft them with a bottle of water.
Water bottles can take up a bit of space. So let's make a canteen instead. You still have to purify the water but it takes up less space, And you will need it later.

Now that you have a place to keep warm You should gather supplies for tools, armor, basic power, etc.

Let's start simple with some Iron, Osmium, and Copper.

With the materials You gathered You are now able to make a Heat Generator from mekanism. (No it doesn't generate heat)

With this generator you can use it 2 ways:

1, Put lava or solid fuels such as coal inside of it to generate power.

2, Put lava around the sides of the generator to passively make power.

I (The book) Recommend a combination of both since the 2nd one doesn't make a lot of power.

Now that we have power we can charge a temperature regulator, this will allow you to stay warm as long as you have power. It will also keep you cool inside of the nether where the blizzard some how didn't freeze the entire place.

To get ice cubes simply break ice blocks.

To get magma shards simply break magma blocks.

Now that we have power we can power a thirst quencher that will keep us hydrated until it runs out of water.

To use it simply use it like a bucket on water to refill it, then just charge it using something like our heat generator we made earlier.

The nether has some useful supplies including magma blocks that we can mine for magma shards for a later quest.

I would recommend getting iron gear, however wearing armor without some way of staying cool isn't recommended since it heats you up.

There are multiple mods that can make power from coal, EnderIO being one of them.

Let's start with a simple stirling generator.

Now that we have a simple stirling generator, we can upgrade it to make it run more efficently, which makes it generate more power.

We can also give it a capacitor to upgrade it so that it will make even more power.

With the combustion generator we can burn liquid fuels as long as we also have a coolent such as water.

Note that this generator (and the next combustion generator tier) cannot burn lava, instead use the stirling generator or the mekanism heat generator.

While EnderIO solar panels look really cool they won't produce nearly as much once you hit tier 5 solars from thermal solars. However they are a bit cheaper to make.

You can also extract the energy from all solar panels while connected to only 1 panel if the rest of your panels are connected together.

Starting with tier 1!

You can keep upgrading the same solar panel through out these next quests, or make a new one each time.

No Description

Getting a base setup is pretty important. (even if it's a small setup in some random hole or cave)

Let's get some supplies that you will probably use.

At this point it would be good to store the power we are making, let's make a basic capacitor bank.

If you make multiple you can place them next to each other for even more storage.

While at first these solars aren't as good as EnderIO solars, they have a lot more tiers and quickly make more then EnderIO's panels.

Sadly you have to connect every panel to a wire though.

The crafting is also a much longer rabbit hole and can get quite expensive quite quickly.

Fun fact: You need 8192 of these to craft the best solar panel in the game.

The first chapter that helps you survive this frozen world.
There are a bunch of ways of making power in this pack. Let's make a few... Okay maybe more then a few.
